result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Heilman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael R Heilman in court with attorney Earl Gray.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:32 p.m.  AO-Clerk.  

COUNT 1 - AMEND 961.41(3g)(e) misd. poss THC. De plea NC. Ct accepts plea, adj. guilty. Judgment entered 10/10/2017.
COUNT 2 - AMEND 961.41(3g)(e) misd. poss THC. De plea NC. Ct accepts plea, adj. guilty. Judgment entered 10/10/2017.
COUNT 4 - AMEND misd. poss. para. De plea NC.  Ct accepts plea, adj. guilty. Judgment entered 10/10/2017.
COUNT 3 - DRI

SENTENCE: 

Count 1 - w/h up to 9 mo. prob, early discharge after 6 mo. possible.  To run concurrent with Count 2.  $200.00 DNA sample & surcharge, follow through with prob. 60 days cond. JT, subj to WR. 
Count 2 - w/h up to 9 mo. prob, early discharge after 6 mo. possible.  To run concurrent with Count 1.  $200.00 DNA sample & surcharge, follow through with prob. 60 days cond. JT, subj to WR. 
Count 4 - $200 DNA sample & surcharge, fines/costs $265.60 payable to COCC, 60 dtp or set up PP.
